Row.Text: Receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Food] Food, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production for [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between your own cities. Factories receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production.
Spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original district cost. Builders receive an additional charge.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states. Builds spies twice as fast. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Class Struggle civic.
Additional Economic policy slot. Sewers provide an additional +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
One Military policy slot in current government is converted to a Wildcard policy slot. Builds Commercial, Campus, and Industrial Zone districts in half the time.
Additional Diplomatic policy slot with the Political Philosophy civic.
All Spies start with the Seduction promotion (better counterspy). Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other Civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold to England.
Stock Exchanges receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, Research Labs receive +2 [ICON_Science] Science, and Power Plants receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Rainforest. Oil Wells and Offshore Oil Rigs yield +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Accumulute 3 extra Oil per turn per improved resource. Oil Wells and Offshore Oil Rigs yield +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Oasis tiles produce +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production for Barracks, Stable, Armory, and Military Academy. Military Engineers have four additional charges.
Receive two random Inspirations whenever you enter a new era.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other Civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold to Australia. Mines on resources provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Builds Commercial, Harbor, and Industrial Zone districts in half the time. Oil Wells and Offshore Oil Rigs yield +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Fishing Boats. Double experience for naval units.
For every era you advance beyond the Ancient Era, your capital city receives +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, +2 [ICON_Science] Science, and +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Additional Economic policy slot. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other Civilizations provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to Argentina.
+5% [ICON_Faith] Faith per City-State you are a Suzerain of. Each envoy sent to a city-state of Iran's majority Religion counts as two Envoys.
Power Plants provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other Civilizations provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to Pakistan.
Suffer half the normal war weariness. Gain +2% [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Great Person your Civilization has ever earned.
No penalties to yields in occupied cities. Pay half the usual cost to levy city state units.
Cities earn +10% [ICON_Culture] Culture when your civilization is at peace.
Cities do not incur war weariness. +2 Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a surprise war.
Spy level is increased by 1 for offensive operations. Spy operations take 25% less time. Spec Ops units earn experience twice as fast.
One Military and one economic policy slot in current government are converted to Wildcard policy slots.
All Cities gain +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities but -4 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Receive +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between your own cities. Build Campus districts in half the time.
Receive one additional Military policy slot. +50% yields from plot harvests and feature removals.
Cities with an established Governor recieve +5% [ICON_Gold] Gold and +5% [ICON_Production] Production for each promotion that Governor has.
+100% Alliance Points from trading with Allies. Grievances against this leader decay at twice the usual rate.
All Cities gain +2 Loyalty per turn. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards Government district and buildings.
All Cities gain +2 [ICON_Production] Production but -4 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Building a Farm triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles.
Holy Sites provide +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. One Military and one Economic policy slot in current government are converted to Wildcard policy slots.
Coal mines accumulate 2 more resources per turn. Iron, aluminum, and uranium mines accumulate 1 more resources per turn. Your trade routes to other Civilizations provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+3 [ICON_Housing] Housing in coastal cities. Yields from Campuses, Commercial Hubs, Holy Sites and Theater Squares are +1 in tiles with Charming Appeal, +3 in Breathtaking.
Tourism from Seaside Resorts doubled. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture from Relics, Artifacts, and Great Works.
Coastal tiles provide +1 [ICON_Food] Food. Builds Harbor districts in one-fifth the time.
Units in friendly territory receive +5 combat bonus. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for cities with a garrisoned unit.
Bonus resources provide +4 [ICON_Food] Food when improved with a Farm, Pasture, or Plantation.
Holy Sites produce +4 [ICON_Faith] Faith. Holy Site and Campus district buildings can be bought with [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Bonus [ICON_Faith] Faith equivalent to 50% strength of each enemy unit killed. All units move faster in hills. Melee, Ranged, and Anti-Cavalry class units have +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Hills.
Cities receive +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for every 2 Specialty Districts constructed and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for every 3 Specialty Districts constructed.
Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Food] Food. Commercial Hub districts produce +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Oil Wells and Offshore Oil Rigs yield +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Your Campus districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
Receive a second melee unit each time you train a melee unit. All units outside friendly territory receive -5 combat strength penalty
Units in friendly territory receive +5 combat bonus. Melee and Ranged class units gain +50% experience from combat.
Wonders provide an additional +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Wonder tourism doubled.
A building unique to Canada. Provides double the Amenities of a normal Stadium. Bonus extends to each city center within 6 tiles.
A building unique to Australia. Provides +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing, in addition to the regular benefits of the Hangar, which it replaces.

A building unique to Mexico. Its [ICON_Production] Production bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type. Half the maintenance and half the construction cost of a normal Factory.
A building unique to Indonesia. Provides a +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, in addition to the regular benefits of the Shipyard, which it replaces.
A building unique to Turkey. +1 [ICON_Science] Science in addition to the regular benefits of the Library, which it replaces.
A building unique to Iran. Provides double the experience and Great General points of the Barracks, which it replaces.

A building unique to Pakistan. Its [ICON_Production] Production bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type. +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each Sheep, Cotton, and Silk resource worked by the City in which it is built.

A building unique to South Korea. Provides double the Great Merchant points of the Stock Exchange, which it replaces. After researching the Electricity technology, provides an additional +5 [ICON_Science] Science.
A building unique to North Korea. Provides +4 Loyalty per Turn, but less Culture than the Broadcast Center, which it replaces.

A building unique to Italy. Its [ICON_Production] Production bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource worked by the City in which it is built. Double the Great Engineer points of a normal Factory.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct an Estancia, unique to Argentina.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to a Pasture. Cannot be built adjacent to another Estancia or on Desert, Tundra, or Snow.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Deep Mine, unique to South Africa.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Production] Production and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Can only be built on Coal, Silver, Diamonds, and Uranium.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Nature Reserve, unique to South Africa.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to rainforest, river, camp, or pasture (bonus cumulative). Can only be built on Grassland and Plains.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Kibbutz, unique to Israel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Gains an additional +1 [ICON_Food] Food with the Conservation civic and +1 [ICON_Production] Production with the Class Struggle Civic. Cannot be built adjacent to another Kibbutz or on Desert, Tundra, or Snow.

A district unique to Nigeria. Replaces the Neighborhood district.[NEWLINE]Provides housing based on the Appeal of the tile:[NEWLINE]Breathtaking: +8 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Charming: +7 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Average: +6 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Uninviting: +5 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Disgusting: +4 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Stronger than the Modern Armor.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Stronger than the Modern Armor, and has a bonus defense against city attacks.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Has higher movement than the Modern Armor, and is cheaper to build.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Has higher movement than the Modern Armor.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Has a bonus when fighting on Hills.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Stronger than the Modern Armor.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Stronger than the Modern Armor.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Cheaper to build and maintain.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Has higher movement than the Modern Armor.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Stronger than the Modern Armor.
Unique unit that replaces the Modern Armor. Stronger than the Modern Armor, and has a bonus defense against anti-cavalry units.
Unique unit that replaces the Helicopter. Has an attack bonus against armor units, and has an adjacency bonus when next to infantry units.
Unique unit that replaces the Helicopter. Stronger than the Helicopter, and has an attack bonus against armor units.
Unique unit that replaces the Helicopter. Slightly stronger than the Helicopter, has greater range, and has an attack bonus against armor units.
Unique unit that replaces the Helicopter. Stronger than the Helicopter, has greater range, and has an attack bonus against armor units.
Unique unit that replaces the Helicopter. Has greater range than the Helicopter, and has an attack bonus against armor units.
Unique unit that replaces the Helicopter. Has an attack bonus against armor units.

Unique unit that replaces the Jet Fighter. Stronger than the Jet Fighter, and has Stealth capabilities that give it an additional +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Fighter and Anti-Air units.

Unique unit that replaces the Jet Fighter. Stronger and with greater range than the Jet Fighter, and has Stealth capabilities that give it an additional +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Fighter and Anti-Air units.
Unique unit that replaces the Jet Fighter. Stronger and with greater range than the Jet Fighter.
Unique unit that replaces the Jet Fighter. Stronger than the Jet Fighter.
Unique unit that replaces the Jet Fighter. Stronger than the Jet Fighter.
Unique bomber unit that has Stealth capabilities that give it an additional +20 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against Fighter and Anti-Air units .
Unique unit that replaces the Jet Bomber. Stronger and has greater range than the Jet Bomber.
Unique unit that replaces the Jet Bomber. Stronger than the Jet Bomber.
Unique unit that replaces the Jet Bomber. Stronger and has greater range than the Jet Bomber.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser. Stronger than the Missile Cruiser.
Unique unit that replaces the Nuclear Submarine. Stronger than the Nuclear Submarine.
Unique unit that replaces the Nuclear Submarine. Stronger than the Nuclear Submarine.
Unique unit that replaces the Nuclear Submarine. Stronger than the Nuclear Submarine.
Unique unit that replaces the Nuclear Submarine. Stronger than the Nuclear Submarine.
Unique unit that replaces the Nuclear Submarine. Stronger than the Nuclear Submarine.
Unique unit that replaces the Nuclear Submarine. Stronger than the Nuclear Submarine.

Replace.Text: Atomic era melee naval unit that can transport air units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns a slow trickle of passive XP when carrying aircraft at sea when your Civilization is at war.

Row.Text: Unique unit that replaces the Aircraft Carrier. Stronger and has more movement than the Aircraft Carrier. Can carry 4 fighters instead of the usual 2. Uses Uranium instead of Oil for fuel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns a slow trickle of passive XP when carrying aircraft at sea when your Civilization is at war.
Unique unit that replaces the Aircraft Carrier. Stronger than the Aircraft Carrier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns a slow trickle of passive XP when carrying aircraft at sea when your Civilization is at war.
Unique unit that replaces the Aircraft Carrier. Stronger than the Aircraft Carrier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns a slow trickle of passive XP when carrying aircraft at sea when your Civilization is at war.
Unique unit that replaces the Aircraft Carrier. Stronger than the Aircraft Carrier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns a slow trickle of passive XP when carrying aircraft at sea when your Civilization is at war.

Unique unit that replaces the Aircraft Carrier. Stronger and has more movement than the Aircraft Carrier. Uses Uranium instead of Oil for fuel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns a slow trickle of passive XP when carrying aircraft at sea when your Civilization is at war.
Unique unit that replaces the Mechanized Infantry. Cheaper to build and maintain.
